sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 38 students at a secondary school and three adults are killed by a suspected Islamic extremist rebel group in western Uganda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The bodies of 38 students and three others were found burned, shot or hacked to death at Lubiriya Secondary School in the border town of Mpondwe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The local mayor, Celivest Mapoze, told the Associated Press that some of the students were burnt to death when the rebels set fire to their dormitory, whilst others were shot or hacked with machetes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The authorities have blamed the Allied Democratic Forces, a shadowy extremist group with ties to the Islamic State, which has been launching attacks for years from bases in neighbour neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo. At least six people were abducted by the rebels who fled across the porous border, according to the Ugandan military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Troops are now pursuing them to rescue the abducted students who were forced to carry looted food towards Congo's Varunga National Park, the military said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's main international economic forum in St. Petersburg used to be designed to attract

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: foreign capital to Russia, but Western sanctions have led many international investors to stay away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Western journalists used to attend the forum, but now they're almost all banned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: President Putin on Friday used the gathering to announce the first batch of nuclear weapons has been deployed to neighboring Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This happened. The first nuclear weapons were delivered to Belarus. But only the first.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is the first part. But by the end of the summer, by the end of the year, we will complete this work completely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: President Putin also boasted of having more nuclear weapons than NATO and rejected the idea of rejoining negotiations on reducing both of their nuclear arsenals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Analysts fear that could trigger a new nuclear arms race and increase the risk of a nuclear conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that F-16 fighter jets will burn in Ukraine if the West equips Kyiv with what would be the most sophisticated military support material supplied to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Putin said the move would present a serious danger of NATO getting further drawn into this armed conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A delegation of African leaders met President Zelensky on Friday and called on Russia and Ukraine to de-escalate and negotiate, hours after sheltering from missile strikes on Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The high-level diplomatic team was there to voice the concerns of a continent that has suffered from the fallout of the war, including rising grain and energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A third strong tremor hit the west coast of France on Saturday morning, registering 5.1 on the Richter scale.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Friday, a tremor of 5.8 hit in the early evening, forcing the 500 or so residents in the village of La Laine to be evacuated after cracks appeared in many of their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They were given shelter in municipal buildings in neighboring villages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The tremors also affected the town of Niur, resulting in several minor injuries and some 1,100 homes losing power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The results of Montenegro's election last week did not give a clear answer as to the formation of a new government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: What lies next for the Western Balkan country and its long aspirations to join the EU was the hot topic on everyone's lips.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Most of the political parties have the same goal and that goal is until the end of the mandate of that new government and that new parliament in 2027 to Montenegro be fully ready for the joining of EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Montenegro applied for EU membership in 2008.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Absevich, though, wants to see less pleasantries and more movements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's not only enough to say yes the door is open, please come if you are ready, you are acceptable, but it needs to be something done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The leaders of the Western Balkan countries from this Prespa Forum send a message to you that it is a high time to move from words to action that will accelerate the path of the country from the region towards EU membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Struga, North Macedonia, for Euronews, Borjan Jovanovski.
